parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set the destination for path planning of the pilot.

Possible values for planningMode are:

* "DoNotPlan" - used when not moving
* "DoNotPlanFormation" - used in formation when simple path testing is used
* "LEADER PLANNED" - used for formation leader (full path finding used)
* "LEADER DIRECT" - used for DirectGo (like getin, supply)
* "FORMATION PLANNED" - used in formation when full path finding is used
* "VEHICLE PLANNED" - used for vehicle driver

Works best when used on [[agents]]. Using "LEADER PLANNED" will trigger <tt>"PathCalculated"</tt> [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#PathCalculated | Event Handler]]

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setDestination''' [position, planningMode, forceReplan]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [position, planningMode, forceReplan]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - format [[Position]]
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> planningMode: [[String]]
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> forceReplan: [[Boolean]] Specifies if replanning of the path should be forced.

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>bob [[setDestination]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5], "LEADER PLANNED", [[true]]]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[expectedDestination]], [[doMove]], [[calculatePath]]
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
